title: Need a Rioter or Wrenchmen to help with my issue please: PING
body: I get 12 ping during the day, but when I play at night it spikes to 70 ping which is a huge jump. Can someone help me with this issue please? I am still waiting for my ISP engineers to do work on their end aswell.

replies.body: You get 12 ping? And you want help with 70 ping? Bruh, my lowest recorded for me is 54, which is kinda my norm, but legit 70 is a good spot to be

When you play on 12 everyday, you will notice a huge difference. I suggest 3 things for a bettet gaming exerpience.
1. Run a speedtest, make sure you are getting the correct speeds and ping. If not, call your ISP.
2. Always use a Ethernet cable.
3. Use a static IP address and not a Dynamic one. Multiple people on this thread are having issues by the looks of it. Let me know if you have tried these things out!

Do you think you would know why Netflix seems to mess with my internet so much?
I'm being serious when I say that the moment my sisters start a show of theirs, the internet starts spiking like crazy, eventually slowing down, but only a minute or so.
Think you could help?

p.s. what's a dynamic and static IP address

Sure! I will be glad to help!
The thing is nowadays, everything is connected to the internet. So when you are on league for example and lets say you get 5mbps download speed. Then your sisters want to watch netflix, this 5mbps will drop down to lets say 2 depending on what they watch and how much speed/data they will use. It is essential you have unlimited internet so you don't get capped and can share the internet with no worries. I am with NBN so the speeds are awesome! My brother can go on league and I can go on youtube or whatever and the ping is still 12! And the closer you are to the exchange. The better internet you will get. What modem do you use? And what internet do you use if you don't mind me asking :)
A dynamic IP is a shared IP address that multiple devices can use for less fuss (to connect them) however a static IP is much faster as you create your own IP address which is great for gaming as it is better then dynamic IP. If you wan't, I can show you how to create a static IP address :) and always make sure you use a ethernet cable! It just mainly comes down to your internet plan and how close you are to the exhange. Hope this helps! Please tell me what else you would like to know :)

I'm actually with NBN as well, but that's the thing. It might be that I don't have unlimited internet (I'm not exactly the age to make the rules in the house yet :p). I'm with iiNet at the moment

I wouldn't mind knowing how to get a static IP address, if it wouldn't take too long

Ahh ok no worries! Yeah im on the 12mbps plan with unlimited. I can't wait to change to 100mbps download! Sure add me and we can go from there! It will only take 2 minutes :) I find it strange, you are with nbn and getting crappy ping. Try ringing up your ISP, that is not the NBN standard

First of all 70 ping isn't even that high and that's probably because more people are playing at night for your timezone? Or maybe there are more people using your home network.

If you are really annoyed by 70 ping then maybe downloading Cfosspeed would help or connecting a LAN cable to the router to your computer would help.

I have a Dioloma in I.T so I know all about how to get the best gaming experience. Like I said in my post, I think it is from the ISP's end. 70 ping feels laggy for me. What is Cfosspeed? I need to see if it is the Riot server issue but I think it would be on the ISP end.
I've been using cfosspeed and it decrease my ping from like 60 to 35. Cfosspeed is basically a program that focuses the internet usage to the program that you want to use

I have a Linksys WRT1900AC, it comes with an app priority function built in, it even has the League of Legends client in the pre-built games list. Similar thing i guess, but yeah my latency is far lower now since giving program priority
So like WTFast? But this case it is a program and not a DNS?

70 ping?

My ping just goes off the charts at times.
I get 12 during the day which is so freaken beautiful but during the night it spikes, my ISP are escalating it to the Engineers. So it is their end :)
